messages.title: What's wrong with the EU?
messages.content: A series of reasons why the European Union is crippling Britain - compiled by the UK Independence Party.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposition to wasteful EU spending, citing various examples such as the European Parliament’s two seats and the EU's foreign aid budget.
Claims that EU is undemocratic and unaccountable, and calls for a withdrawal from the EU to regain democratic control.
Criticizes high levels of immigration from the EU and supports control over the UK’s immigration policy.

issues.brexitEurope: Arguments to leave the EU focusing on sovereignty, wasteful spending, and lack of democratic accountability.
issues.economy: Discussion on the financial cost of the EU to the UK, including contributions to the EU budget and references to economic impacts on fisheries and agriculture.
issues.governance: The leaflet stresses the importance of regaining democratic control and autonomy from the European Union.
issues.immigration: Claims that immigration from the EU is overcrowding Britain and that the UK should take back control over its immigration policies.

quotes.text: I was never a fan of the EU from its conception. I believed that it would end up as it has - with too much power in the hands of too few, unelected people. Now that power has to be wrested back.

images.caption: Images related to the impact of the EU on British Agriculture, Fisheries, and democratic processes, as well as images symbolizing opposition to the EU.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet presents a strong anti-EU narrative, underlining perceived negative impacts of EU membership on various sectors and facets of British sovereignty and governance.
